channel.description: Recent content in port on Everyday Linux

item.title: RHEL Port Forwarding Using Firewalld
item.description: RHEL Port Forwarding Using Firewalld Never underestimate the simplicity of a feature and the complications of a network. RHEL 7 uses firewalld, which has a very simple syntax for port forwarding across the incoming port of an external interface to a NATed IP on an internal device. No matter what I tried in variations from the base documentation I simply could not get it to work. In this configuration, note that I have eth0 on NetworkManager external zone with masquerade and eth1 on zone internal.
